intro: Corchorus villosissimus, commonly known as the hairy knotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its stout, woody stems covered in dense, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on erect, leafless stalks. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and often have a waxy texture. Corchorus villosissimus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along streambanks.
